page.title: 08SHOECROFT BARN FORGE -BIBURY
page.content: A small forge has been in operation since 1977 in a lean-to to Shoecroft Barn, Bibury. Its principal products are animal feeders and tubular gates and fencing for farms, as well as accessories such as roofracks for Landrovers made for export. In addition, work on farm gates and general repairs are carried out in situ by the blacksmith who normally works on his own. Occasionally an assistant is employed to produce garden gates, flower pedestals and ornamental brackets of wrought iron, mainly to customers' own design. The forge provides a service which is mainly local, but orders are taken for example for machine guards for factories outside the area.
